summary: The text discusses the Organized Crime Control Act 2070, which aims to prevent organized crimes through legal provisions. It includes amendments to various laws related to money laundering, environmental protection, and public security. The Act empowers law enforcement agencies to investigate and prosecute organized crime groups, ensuring peace and security. It also defines the jurisdiction and procedures for handling organized crime cases, both within and outside Nepal. The Act prohibits individuals from engaging in organized criminal activities and outlines severe penalties for serious offenses.

summary: The text discusses the coordination and interrelation between the federal, provincial, and local levels in Nepal, as per the Constitution of Nepal. It emphasizes the strengthening of the federal democratic republic system through cooperation, coordination, and mutual support among these levels. The document outlines the basis for coordination and cooperation, including national interests, protection of national dignity and unity, and adherence to constitutional provisions. It also highlights the importance of equal treatment and security among citizens, as well as the promotion of good governance and anti-corruption measures.

summary: The text discusses the Federal Parliament Secretariat Act, 2064, and its amendments. It also mentions the laws related to the amendment of Nepal's constitution and the establishment of the Federal Parliament Secretariat. The Act defines terms like "Constitution," "Speaker," "Deputy Speaker," "Opposition Party Leader," "Member," "Secretary," "Committee," "Secretary-General," and "Parliamentary Service." It outlines the structure and functions of the Federal Parliament Secretariat and its various officials. The Act also includes provisions for the appointment of employees and the maintenance of discipline within the Parliamentary Service.

summary: The text discusses the provisions related to the remuneration and facilities of the members and officials of the Federal Parliament in Nepal. It includes amendments to the laws governing their salaries and benefits, as well as the process for forming the Council of Ministers. The text also outlines the roles and responsibilities of various officials within the Parliament.

summary: The text discusses the Federal Parliament's Joint Meeting and Joint Committee (Operation) Regulations, 2080 published in the Nepal Gazette. It outlines the formation and operation of the Joint Meeting and Joint Committee of both houses of the Federal Parliament in accordance with Article 104(2) of the Constitution. The regulations provide guidelines for the functioning of the Joint Meeting and Joint Committee, including the roles of members and the Secretary-General. The regulations aim to facilitate the smooth operation of the Federal Parliament.
